ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Worked on a WASH (Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) project supported by US Consulate meant to educate 500 girls on maintaining cleanliness, hygiene and using toilets responsibly. program included awareness workshops, DIY activity where we taught girls to sew their own cloth pads, Period Quiz and Games and finally handed over a Resource Material to school authorities which becomes a reference guide for girls. We ended the project with distributing cloth pads to girls from United Colors of Benetton

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Period Pride was organized to provide memorable Period Management experience to young girls of an orphanage in the city of Hyderabad. Period Pride focussed on an Awareness Session addressing 350 girls, a talk by a gynaecologist highlighting hygiene practices, nutritional needs and importance of managing Periods safely and hygienically. We organized fun story telling session and distributed hygiene kits to girls which included period essentials for them.

Menstruation forms an integral part of the WASH Project; hence it is important that girls are well trained with appropriate information about managing Menstruation safely and hygienically. They should also be well equipped with unvarying access to products, infrastructure and resources to help them manage their Periods with dignity.

ngoList.title: NARSINGH SWAIN MEMORIAL TRUST
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ACHIEVEMENTS OF NARSINGH SWAIN MEMORIAL TRUST The major achievement of the N Swain Memorial Trust is the Aakar [Shape] Asha [Hope] a Super-Specialty hospital for Reconstructive surgery with a built â€“up area of 55,000 sq.ft. in three floors on 2 acres in a strategic location on NH7, the crowded area of once Asiaâ€™s biggest housing localities that is Kukatpally, Hyderabad with an investment of around Rs. 9 crore. The one of its kind project won an award at the 2nd ISB iDiya competition in 2012. Aakar Asha is a referral Centre for Reconstructive Surgery. Apart from Reconstructive Plastic Surgery Orthopedics, Cancer and Pediatric Reconstructive surgeries are done. Specialized services like Oral and Maxillofacial surgery, Dermatology services play a significant role. The allied specialized services that are required for all round requirement of the patient like: Anesthesiologists and Pain management specialists, Physician and Neurologist, Pediatrician, General and Laparoscopic Surgeons and ENT surgeon provide the support services needed for the delightful experience of poor patients during their stay at the Hospital. A state of art Physical Rehab department completes the picture. The hospital has its own 24 x 7 Pharmacy, Diagnostic facilities (clinical pathology, biochemistry and Radiology with Color Doppler), with 3 Operating Theaters [including laminar theater as per NABH guideline], 2 ICUs and Post Op area. It has a capacity of 130 beds with 51 beds in operation of three different categories: General, Sharing and Single rooms other than ICU beds. Besides, the hospital has Dormitory facilities for accommodation of the attendants of the patient during treatment period with in the premises. The kitchen and cafeteria within the premises take care of the patients and their attendantâ€™s dietary needs and provide food for the patientâ€™s attendants. The hospital was built to take care of patient from undivided Andhra Pradesh [presently Telangana and Andhra Pradesh], where the incidence of deformities are high. However, the patient from the neighboring states are been treated with same care and sincerity. The Trust, guided by its objectives, has strived to work for the physically disabled, especially those below poverty line. Activities include creating awareness amongst stakeholders about reconstructive surgery bringing about a transformation in the lives of the physically disabled and helping to identify the beneficiaries; screening camps and reconstructive surgery camps; education and training of doctors and the public. Since 2001, we have conducted more than 30 awareness camps and have distributed literature pertaining to knowledge of physical disability and availability of treatment. No less than 20 free screening camps have been conducted wherein around 1400 persons have been screened for undergoing surgery for physical disability and 900 Physically Disabled persons have undergone reconstructive surgery free of cost since inception of the Trust. 11 Continuing Medical Education programs have been conducted, 8 of which have been the innovative Basic Surgical Skills workshops in which about 250 doctors have been trained hands on. 1 workshop on physiotherapy and a Lifesavers program for first responders have been conducted

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Pushpagiri Vitreo Retina Institute Society has set up a super speciality eye hospital with state of theart facilities by name Pushpagiri Eye Institute in Secunderabad a not for profit charitable eye hospital to combat the causes of blindness such as Diabetic Retinopathy Childhood Blindness eye diseases Glaucoma and cataract with the mission to place the finest in eye care within reach of the common The focus of Institute is on organziing comprehensive eye camps conducting Continuing Medical Education for Fellow Ophthalmologists and students establishing training and Post graduate teaching in Ophthalmology with high quality standards placement of qualified professionals in specialized eye-care for control of blindness. We have treated over 15000 outpatients thousands of surgeries have been performed of which around 55% were free. Over 18400 school children have been screened and more than 200 premature children screened for Retinopathy of Prematurity.
